page.title: 02The Kielder Forest Drive
page.content: The Kielder Forest Drive is a toll road connecting Kielder village with the A68 road just south of{Byrness}. The eastern end of the Drive is at { {Blakehopeburnhaugh}(the longest place name in England). The toll for the drive is 50p, and the road is open to the public from Easter to September, or later if you are lucky! The Forestry Commission have made the journey through the forest most interesting by the siting of picnic spots,walks and trails, as well as explanatory descriptions of trees planted and the various stages of maturity reached. Those fortunate to traverse the route in quieter times of the year may disturb roe deer on or by the road. There is a speed limit of 25mph, and a lot of potholes to enforce it!
